name: akeyless-secrets
description: An Azure DevOps extension to safely retrieve static and dynamic secrets from your AKeyless vault and create Pipeline secret variables.
author: Lance McCarthy

inputs.name: accessid
inputs.label: Access ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The access id of your auth method (ex: 'p-iwt13fd19ajd').

inputs.name: azureJwt
inputs.label: Azure JWT
inputs.helpMarkDown: The JWT token generated by your Azure service principal in a previous task. For example, $(PreviousTaskId.AZURE_JWT).

inputs.name: staticSecrets
inputs.label: Static Secrets
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Static secrets to fetch from AKeyless. This must be a dictionary object, where the 'key' is the secret's path in akeyless and the 'value' is what you want the output variable to be named. 

Example: {"/path/to/static/secret":"my_first_secret", "/path/to/another/secret":"my_second_secret"}.

inputs.name: dynamicSecrets
inputs.label: Dynamic Secrets
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Dynamic secret to fetch from AKeyless. This must be a dictionary object, where the 'key' is the secret's path in akeyless and the 'value' is what you want the output variable to be named.

Example: {"/path/to/secret":"name_of_output_var"}.

inputs.name: apiUrl
inputs.label: Akeyless API Url
inputs.helpMarkDown: Overrides the URL to the akeyless API server. Warning - Do not set this unless you know what you're doing!
